blocks.text: join up all the points like Q, thus obtaining the curve CQLS, which is termed the first moment curve.

To obtain the 2nd moment curve treat the area CPXKSLQ in the same way as the original area was treated, i.e., drop QR′ perpendicular to MM, and join RR′; join up all points like D, and the 2nd moment curve is obtained.

blocks.description: The figure illustrates the relationship between the curves and the various areas labeled A₀, A₁ and A₂. It shows the steps in calculating the first moment curve and the second moment curve based on the specific areas.
